params.name: inventoryItems
params.doc: List of inventory items to be created.

examples.title: bulkCreateInventoryItems example for dashboard page code
bulkCreateInventoryItems example for exporting from backend code

params.name: decrementData
params.doc: Which inventory items to decrement, and how much to decrement from each one.

docs.summary:
Decrement inventory items quantity.
The item must be on track for allowing quantity decrement.
A bulk decrement request is all or nothing if the restrict_inventory is true and at least one of the items goes into negative inventory or passes the preOrder limit,
the request will fail with an INSUFFICIENT_INVENTORY error and an increment back operation will be executed.
The item quantity can go into negative if restrict_inventory is false or the item has been purchased as preOrder.
When preorder_request is true and the item is available for preOrder, Item preorder_counter will increase and item quantity will stay the same.

examples.title: bulkDecrementInventoryItems example for dashboard page code
bulkDecrementInventoryItems example for exporting from backend code

params.name: filter

docs.summary:
Decrement the inventory quantity to the items which satisfy the provided filter.
The item must be on track for allowing quantity decrement.
The item quantity cannot go into negative.

examples.title: bulkDecrementInventoryItemsByFilter example for dashboard page code
bulkDecrementInventoryItemsByFilter example for exporting from backend code

params.name: decrementData
params.doc: Which inventory items to decrement, and how much to decrement from each one.

docs.summary:
Decrement inventory items quantity.
The item must be on track for allowing quantity decrement.
A bulk decrement request is all or nothing if the restrict_inventory is true and at least one of the items goes into negative inventory or passes the preOrder limit,
the request will fail with an INSUFFICIENT_INVENTORY error and an increment back operation will be executed.
The item quantity can go into negative if restrict_inventory is false or the item has been purchased as preOrder.
When preorder_request is true and the item is available for preOrder, Item preorder_counter will increase and item quantity will stay the same.

params.name: productInventoryItems
params.doc:
List of inventory items per product. All existing inventory items for given product in given location_id will be replaced by ones provided in this request.
>**Note:** you can provide up to 1000 inventory items in total. For example you can provide 100 products with 10 inventory items in each or 1 product with 1000 inventory items or something in between.

docs.summary:
Sets inventory items on specific products.
If existing `id` provided for a inventory item in request, then this inventory item updated with new values provided in the request.
If `id` is not provided for inventory item, then a new inventory item will be created.
If there were any inventory items related to given product in given location and they are not provided by ids in request, then these inventory items will be removed.
After calling this endpoint the product in given location will have all and only inventory items provided in BulkSetInventoryItemsForProductsInLocationRequest.
All inventory items in the provided request must have the same product_id as provided in the request param.
All inventory items in the provided request must have the same location_id as provided in the request param.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

Pass the relevant cursor token from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Maximum number of items to return in the results.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursor strings that point to the next page, previous page, or both.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Whether there are more pages to retrieve following the current page.

+ `true`: Another page of results can be retrieved.
+ `false`: This is the last page.

members.name: aggregations
members.doc: Aggregations | Faceted search: refers to a way to explore large amounts of data by displaying summaries about various partitions of the data and later allowing to narrow the navigation to a specific partition.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc:
Cursor pointing to page of results.
When requesting 'cursor_paging.cursor', no `filter`, `sort` or `search` can be provided.

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: search
members.doc: Free text to match in searchable fields

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.name: timeZone
members.doc:
UTC offset or IANA time zone. Valid values are
ISO 8601 UTC offsets, such as +02:00 or -06:00,
and IANA time zone IDs, such as Europe/Rome

Affects all filters and aggregations returned values.
You may override this behavior in a specific filter by providing
timestamps including time zone. e.g. `"2023-12-20T10:52:34.795Z"`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc:
Cursor pointing to page of results.
When requesting 'cursor_paging.cursor', no `filter`, `sort` or `search` can be provided.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor string pointing to the next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to the previous page in the list of results.

members.name: interval
members.doc: Interval for date histogram aggregation

members.name: count
members.doc: Count of documents in the bucket

members.name: value
members.doc: Date in ISO 8601 format

members.name: results
members.doc: List of date histogram aggregations

members.name: decrementBy
members.doc: Quantity to decrement by.

members.name: inventoryItemId
members.doc: Id of the Inventory item.

members.name: preorderRequest
members.doc:
Whether the request to decrement the item's inventory was made as part of a purchase that includes preorder items.
If true and the item is available for preorder in the default location, we allow negative inventory.
If false and the item is not available for preorder, we allow regular buy flow (no negative inventory).

members.doc: Quantity to decrement by.

members.name: locationId
members.doc: Id of the Location.

members.name: preorderRequest
members.doc:
Whether the request to decrement the item's inventory was made as part of a purchase that includes preorder items.
If true and the item is available for preorder in the default location, we allow negative inventory.
If false and the item is not available for preorder, we allow regular buy flow (no negative inventory).

members.name: variantId
members.doc: Id of the Variant.

members.name: inventoryItemId
members.doc: Id of the Inventory item to delete.

members.name: _id
members.doc:
Unique event ID.
Allows clients to ignore duplicate webhooks.

members.name: entityEventSequence
members.doc:
A sequence number defining the order of updates to the underlying entity.
For example, given that some entity was updated at 16:00 and than again at 16:01,
it is guaranteed that the sequence number of the second update is strictly higher than the first.
As the consumer, you can use this value to ensure that you handle messages in the correct order.
To do so, you will need to persist this number on your end, and compare the sequence number from the
message against the one you have stored. Given that the stored number is higher, you should ignore the message.

members.name: entityFqdn
members.doc:
Assumes actions are also always typed to an entity_type
Example: wix.stores.catalog.product, wix.bookings.session, wix.payments.transaction

members.name: entityId
members.doc: ID of the entity associated with the event.

members.name: eventTime
members.doc: Event timestamp.

members.name: originatedFrom
members.doc: If present, indicates the action that triggered the event.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
This is top level to ease client code dispatching of messages (switch on entity_fqdn+slug)
This is although the created/updated/deleted notion is duplication of the oneof types
Example: created/updated/deleted/started/completed/email_opened

members.name: triggeredByAnonymizeRequest
members.doc:
Whether the event was triggered as a result of a privacy regulation application
(for example, GDPR).

members.name: deletedEntityAsJson
members.doc: Entity that was deleted

members.name: currentEntityAsJson
members.doc:
Since platformized APIs only expose PATCH and not PUT we can't assume that the fields sent from the client are the actual diff.
This means that to generate a list of changed fields (as opposed to sent fields) one needs to traverse both objects.
We don't want to impose this on all developers and so we leave this traversal to the notification recipients which need it.

members.name: namespaces
members.doc:
Extended field data. Each key corresponds to the namespace of the app that created the extended fields.
The value of each key is structured according to the schema defined when the extended fields were configured.

You can only access fields for which you have the appropriate permissions.

Learn more about [extended fields](https://dev.wix.com/docs/rest/articles/getting-started/extended-fields).

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Inventory was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Inventory ID

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Inventory was last updated.

members.name: availability
members.doc: Item availability, availability is combination of status and available quantity.

members.name: availabilityStatus
members.doc:
Item availability status, availability is combination of status and available quantity.
+ OUT_OF_STOCK: no available quantity
+ IN_STOCK: available quantity can be found in `quantity` field.
+ PREORDER: available quantity can be found in `preorderInfo.quantity` field.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: Extensions enabling users to save custom data related to the inventory item.

members.name: inStock
members.doc: Inventory tracking status, when set to true, item is available for sale without quantity limit.

members.name: locationId
members.doc: Location ID, location_id with variant_id is unique.

members.name: preorderInfo
members.doc: Item preorder info.

members.name: product
members.doc: Product.

members.name: productId
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: quantity
members.doc:
Quantity currently left in inventory.
In some scenarios, quantity could go negative, for example when decreasing inventory for an order that has already been paid.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision.

members.name: trackQuantity
members.doc: Whether the quantity is being tracked.

members.name: variantId
members.doc: Variant ID.

description: InventoryItem is the main entity of InventoryService

members.name: newInStock
members.doc: Inventory item new status.

members.name: previousInStock
members.doc: Inventory item previous status.

description: Report when Inventory item stock status changed from in stock to out of stock and the opposite.

members.name: inStock
members.doc: Inventory tracking status, when set to true, item is available for sale without quantity limit.

members.name: quantity
members.doc:
Quantity currently left in inventory.
In some scenarios, quantity could go negative, for example when decreasing inventory for an order that has already been paid.

members.name: appId
members.doc:
ID of the app that updated this inventory item.
When Wix Stores updates an inventory item, `app_id` will be: `"215238eb-22a5-4c36-9e7b-e7c08025e04e"`.

members.name: currentEntity
members.doc: Current entity

members.name: reason
members.doc: The reason for the inventory change.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor pointing to page of results. Cannot be used together with `paging`. `cursorPaging.cursor` can not be used together with `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Cannot be used together with `cursorPaging`.

members.name: quantity
members.doc: Available quantity, when not defined then unlimited number of items can be purchased.

members.name: status
members.doc:
If `AvailableStatus` is NOT_AVAILABLE the item is not available
If `AvailableStatus` is PURCHASE and available_quantity is N then up to N items can be purchased right now
If `AvailableStatus` is PURCHASE and available_quantity is not defined then unlimited number of items can be purchased right now
If `AvailableStatus` is PREORDER and available_quantity is N then up to N items can be purchased as preorder
If `AvailableStatus` is PREORDER and available_quantity is not defined then unlimited number of items can be purchased as preorder

members.name: _id
members.doc: Item ID. Should always be available, unless it's impossible (for example, when failing to create an item).

members.name: error
members.doc: Details about the error in case of failure.

members.name: originalIndex
members.doc: Index of the item within the request array. Allows for correlation between request and response items.

members.name: success
members.doc: Whether the requested action was successful for this item. When `false`, the `error` field is populated.

members.name: inventoryItem
members.doc: Inventory item to be updated, may be partial.

members.doc: Stringify payload.

members.doc: The identification type and identity data.

members.name: instanceId
members.doc: App instance ID.

members.name: nestedAggregations
members.doc: Flattened list of aggregations, where each next aggregation is nested within previous one

description: Nested aggregation expressed through a list of aggregation where each next aggregation is nested within previous one

members.doc: Date histogram aggregation

members.doc: Field to aggregate by, use dont notation to specify json path

members.name: name
members.doc: User-defined name of aggregation, should be unique, will appear in aggregation results

members.doc: Scalar aggregation

description:
Results of `NESTED` aggregation type in a flattened form
aggregations in resulting array are keyed by requested aggregation `name`.

members.name: nestedResults
members.doc: Nested aggregations

members.name: value
members.doc: Value of the field

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the page is on

members.name: pageId
members.doc: Invalidate by Page ID

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query.

members.name: aggregations
members.doc: Aggregations | Faceted search: refers to a way to explore large amounts of data by displaying summaries about various partitions of the data and later allowing to narrow the navigation to a specific partition.

members.name: filter
members.doc: A filter object. See documentation [here](https://bo.wix.com/wix-docs/rnd/platformization-guidelines/api-query-language#platformization-guidelines_api-query-language_defining-in-protobuf)

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Can not be used together with 'cursor_paging'

members.name: search
members.doc: free text to match in searchable fields

members.name: sort
members.doc: Sort object in the form [{"fieldName":"sortField1"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","direction":"DESC"}]

members.name: paging
members.doc: Pointer to page of results using offset. Can not be used together with 'cursor_paging'

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items returned in this response.

members.name: cursors
members.doc: Cursors to navigate through result pages. Returned if cursor paging was used.

members.name: counter
members.doc:
How many times this item was purchased as a preorder, limited by the value of PreorderSettings.limit.
It may cross the limit if the restrict_inventory_value = false.
Supported only for tracking inventory items.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Whether the item is available for preorder.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Optional - Number of products that can be purchased as preorder after stock reaches zero.
If not defined -100,000 products can be purchased as preorder.
Supported only for tracking inventory items.

members.name: message
members.doc: Optional - A message the buyer will see when the item is out of stock and preorder is enabled.

members.name: quantity
members.doc:
Available quantity for preorder.
Supported only for tracking inventory items.

members.name: directCategoryIds
members.doc: A list of categories that this product is included in directly.

members.name: name
members.doc: Product name.

members.name: inventoryItems
members.doc: List of inventory items to be created (if no id provided) or updated (if existing id provided).

members.name: productId
members.doc: The id of the product to set inventory items to.

members.name: query
members.doc: WQL expression

members.name: inventoryItems
members.doc: The retrieved Inventory items.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging metadata. Contains cursor which can be used in next query.

members.name: buckets
members.doc: List of range buckets, where during aggregation each entity will be placed in the first bucket where its value falls into based on provided range bounds

members.name: count
members.doc: Count of entities in this range

members.name: from
members.doc: Inclusive lower bound of the range

members.name: to
members.doc: Exclusive upper bound of the range

members.name: from
members.doc: Inclusive lower bound of the range. Required if to is not given

members.name: to
members.doc: Exclusive upper bound of the range. Required if from is not given

members.name: count
members.doc: Count of entities in this range

members.name: from
members.doc: Inclusive lower bound of the range

members.name: to
members.doc: Exclusive upper bound of the range

members.name: results
members.doc: List of ranges returned in same order as requested

members.name: results
members.doc: List of nested aggregations

members.name: type
members.doc: Define the operator for the scalar aggregation

members.name: value
members.doc: Value of the scalar aggregation

members.name: expression
members.doc: Search term or expression

members.name: fields
members.doc: Fields to search in. If empty - will search in all searchable fields. Use dot notation to specify json path

members.name: fuzzy
members.doc: Flag if should use auto fuzzy search (allowing typos by a managed proximity algorithm)

members.name: mode
members.doc: Defines how separate search terms in `expression` are combined

members.name: search
members.doc: WQL expression.

members.name: search
members.doc: WQL expression.

members.name: aggregationData
members.doc: Aggregation data.

members.name: inventoryItems
members.doc: InventoryItems which satisfy the provided query.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging metadata. Contains cursor which can be used in next query.

members.name: search
members.doc: WQL expression.

members.name: inventoryItems
members.doc: InventoryItems which satisfy the provided query.

members.name: pagingMetadata
members.doc: Paging metadata. Contains cursor which can be used in next query.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.name: metaSiteId
members.doc: the msid the URI is on

members.name: uriPath
members.doc: URI path to invalidate (e.g. page/my/path) - without leading/trailing slashes

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Inventory was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Inventory ID

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Inventory was last updated.

members.name: availability
members.doc: Item availability, availability is combination of status and available quantity.

members.name: availabilityStatus
members.doc:
Item availability status, availability is combination of status and available quantity.
+ OUT_OF_STOCK: no available quantity
+ IN_STOCK: available quantity can be found in `quantity` field.
+ PREORDER: available quantity can be found in `preorderInfo.quantity` field.

members.name: extendedFields
members.doc: Extensions enabling users to save custom data related to the inventory item.

members.name: inStock
members.doc: Inventory tracking status, when set to true, item is available for sale without quantity limit.

members.name: locationId
members.doc: Location ID, location_id with variant_id is unique.

members.name: preorderInfo
members.doc: Item preorder info.

members.name: product
members.doc: Product.

members.name: productId
members.doc: Product ID.

members.name: quantity
members.doc:
Quantity currently left in inventory.
In some scenarios, quantity could go negative, for example when decreasing inventory for an order that has already been paid.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision.

members.name: trackQuantity
members.doc: Whether the quantity is being tracked.

members.name: variantId
members.doc: Variant ID.

members.name: reason
members.doc: Reason data

members.name: inventoryItem
members.doc: Inventory item to be updated, may be partial.

members.name: reason
members.doc: Reason data

members.name: inventoryItem
members.doc: The updated Inventory item.

members.name: includeOptions
members.doc: Options for including missing values

members.name: limit
members.doc: How many aggregations would you like to return? Can be between 1 and 250. 10 is the default.

members.name: missingValues
members.doc: Should missing values be included or excluded from the aggregation results. Default is EXCLUDE

members.name: sortDirection
members.doc: Should sort in ascending or descending order

members.name: sortType
members.doc: Should sort by number of matches or value of the field

members.name: includeOptions
members.doc: Options for including missing values

members.name: count
members.doc: Count of entities with this value

members.name: value
members.doc: Value of the field

members.name: count
members.doc: Count of entities with this value

members.doc: Value of the field

members.doc: List of value aggregations
